name: Toucan Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: Located 10 mins walk from the airport and 10 mins walk from the nearest beach, this hotel is in a great spot. I had a pool room which are a bit smaller than the garden rooms, but I liked the table and chairs and terrace outside (very handy for drying dive gear!). There are safes in the room and decent air con and shower. Rooms are comfortable and clean and great for the price you pay. There was no tv in the room but this really wasn't an issue for me. The music around the bar is turned off at 10:30pm so I didn't notice any noise apart from the dawn chorus of birds and roosters each morning! There is a 24 hour tea and coffee making faclity close to the restaraunt for those who want it. Bottled water is available to buy, but you can also drink the tap water.
reviews.title: Great location and value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The pool is lovely and warm and well mantained. There are sun loungers but they would benefit from having mattresses / cushions on them. Plenty of shaded seating area around the pool too. There are birds that come to feed and hummingbirds in the bushes and trees as well which adds to the tropical setting!
reviews.title: toucan inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel restaurant offers half board and all inclusive packages but the kitchen is only open set hours. It would be good to have even a small snack kiosk / shop forthe times in between as if you are out diving you may miss the 2:30pm lunch time cut off. The food was very good value though with a good choice of dishes and an excellent breakfast of fresh fruit and choice of pancakes or cooked breakfast options. All the staff were very friendly and helpful and service was good.
reviews.title: Well described

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No doubt during your stay you will be introduced to Mr B. He runs some excellent tours and can organise anything you would like to do on the island. We took a trip to see the leatherback turtles nesting, a party bus to Sunday School with drinks provided and a full island tour. I can thoroughly recommend Mr B and his trips - he has won multiple tourism awards and really makes sure you get the most out of your trip. His prices are very reasonable and he is a great character! You will find yourself saying 'don't worry, B happy' and smiling a lot!
reviews.title: Great week in Tobago

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Great trip. This hotel is a great base and great value. Enjoy :)
reviews.title: Average just about sums it up

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Toucan Inn is a small friendly hotel located in Crown Point, Tobago. It has a small swimming pool and and a delightful open air restaurant next to it. The rooms are clean and spacious, the food and meals of good quality and the staff are amazing. Nothing is too much trouble for them. Teaching me how to make frozen daquiries for myself just one example. If you dislike corporate hotels and love the small and friendly then this is the place for you.
reviews.title: Great small hotel Tobago

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a week here in March 2013 on B&B basis. We had a Garden Room which was big and although furnished without frills was clean and comfortable. It was nice and peaceful to be able to sit outside on small terrace and it seemed much better than the Pool rooms which looked smaller and much less private. The meals we had were generally good but had a couple of poor ones. The staff ranged from absolutely charming and helpful to pretty disinterested and sometimes you got the impression no-one was actually running things. The buildings are nice but could do with some general sprucing up. We did a couple of trips with Mr B who is excellent and a lovely guy, and he's much cheaper than the many others who will approach you for trips.
reviews.title: Toucan Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bonkers has a good reputation for food but we had just as good at Coco and The Backyard.
reviews.title: Toucan Inn Tobago

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 1 week in February 2013, everything was good, food was good staff were excellent. Would love to go back to Tobago again, very nice place. Must do another trip with Mr. B. There are lots of things to do and lots of things to see. Very enjoyable week in the sun.
reviews.title: Toucan Inn and R&Sea Divers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: We just returned from Toucan Inn (11 days) - we went there to get our Open Water Scuba Certification with R&Sea Divers. Nice little inn - met some really nice people - fellow scuba divers - most of them seasoned divers who were full of great stories and suggestions - much appreciated and we hope to meet you all again on a return trip! We started out in Cabana #18 - didn't work well for us as it was located adjacent to a yard full of roosters and overflow tables for the restaurant were right outside our door - so we had some noisey late nights and very early noisey mornings - we requested a room change and Lisa (Reception) offered to move us with no problem - we were moved to Garden Room #4 - nice room - large and very quiet with icy cold air (which my husband loved, me not so much). Breakfast was included and we ate some lunches and dinners there as well - food was always good - we tried some of the local specials too. We also ate at some of the local restaurants - beach is a good 10 minute walk. We enjoyed all of our meals - both at the Inn and around the Island. We took two trips with Mr. B - who is a very well informed tour guide and patiently answered all of my questions - we saw most of the island with Mr. B and we really liked what we saw - gorgeous, lush and very hilly island with a lot of bays - some are not suitable for swimming but look lovely. Locals are extremely friendly - always greeting us with a good morning, afternoon or evening. R&Sea Divers - Wendy and John (and Katie, Dive Master) - were amazing! Very professional - from pre-trip emails, to airport pick up, to scuba and +++ Highly recommend them for all of your diving needs - they are located at the Toucan Inn which makes for a perfect Dive/Stay Package. While we were still at the Inn, my husband booked a return trip in April. One wish: a direct flight from Toronto to Tobago - the inter-island Caribbean Airlines flight was quite good, inexpensive but we were forced to take a 1:45 a.m. flight into Trinidad and wait in the airport for our 7 a.m. flight back home - Please WestJet hurry up and offer direct flights.
reviews.title: perfect for Tobago

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: First time we have stayed there but me and the wife liked it quite a bit.
reviews.title: Toucan Inn - A Very Nice and Affordable Hotel...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: PROS: The rooms were clean, orderly and styled very nicely. The food in the restaurant was very good so we ate at the hotel quite a bit for breakfast, lunch and dinner. The hotel is reasonable walking distance to a corner market and a bit farther (but reasonable) to Store Bay Beach and the airport. The staff, especially in the restaurant and bar area were great!! You know you are eating a good restaurant if there are locales eating there that don't stay at the hotel!!
reviews.title: fabulous friendly hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: CONS: There is no refrigerator in the room. This seems like a rather inexpensive enhancement so guests can cool drinks, fruit or leftovers. There are only a few rooms with TV's (Direct TV) and although I admit its sad to want a TV when you are in Tobago, it would have been nice to have to catch news locally or internationally. Its really odd too because they have a massive Direct TV satellite on the back side of the property. Oh, well!
reviews.title: Holiday in tobago

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We still enjoyed the place and would be willing to stay there again on our next visit.
reviews.title: Another fantastic holiday at the Toucan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are bungalows near the pool that look cool, but the rooms are smaller so I would not recommend those.
reviews.title: Wonderful !!!!!! We will be back in 2014

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: Not only an ideal location you’re in walking distance to everything and anything you’ll need. A prompt and reliable taxi service from the airport to the hotel. Clean rooms, friendly staff and great food. I enjoyed my brief visit with you all.
reviews.title: early morning flight,crash pad & breakfast ....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: I went last minute to Tobago for a diving holiday, so only spent the evenings in the hotel. Its definitely 2 star, things are a little worn or tatty and there's not a lot to the place. Its rather like a cheap motel in the US in regards to facilities. If you go expecting pristine facilities anywhere in the Caribbean you're usually out of luck due to heat, humidity, insects, hurricanes, etc, etc. Toucan is no exception. Its clean enough, the food is ok, and the staff are super friendly and a credit to the place.
reviews.title: Friendly but fading

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like many of the more expensive tourist destinations, Tobago has suffered with the global economic turndown. The place used to be jumping, and now its pretty quiet and there were only a couple of guests. Dive shops, resteraunts, etc are all half empty most of the time. At night the bar at the hotel has loud music piped out the bar & pool despite there being no one there, just keeping me awake. Once that goes off the jungle wildlife & local roosters take over to keep you awake the rest of the night. Such is life on a jungle island, I suppose, but be warned - take earplugs.
reviews.title: Lovely Tobago

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The Toucan inn is quite basic accommodation which is reflected in the price, although I feel it could do with a re- fresh. The rooms were kept very clean, we had a garden room which is more spacious than the pool rooms. We would go to breakfast early by the time we got back our room had been cleaned so very prompt cleaning service. The restaurant was very nicely positioned and the food was ok, breakfast for us was included and was very nice good coffee. We found there to be a lack of restaurants in the local vicinity, I think a few more would not go a miss. Pigeon point was the most beautiful beach very pale sand and clear sea, it was a good 45 min walk or taxi.
reviews.title: Small, friendly accomodation at a reasonablecost.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would say the best thing about the hotel was Mr B Happy as he named himself very aptly I would say. He took us too the Pigeon Point beach on our second day and he asked if he would like him to collect us, we said about 5pm maybe...we then decide to call him in case we needed to leave earlier, we called him at 4:30 and he was already in the car park waiting for us...how's that for service. We then went on to do his Sunday School trip, a steel band affair like many other of the islands have, it was the best we have experienced. We then went on to do his infamous Island Tour... What an amazing day he gave us full of information we did the whole Island, it's so beautiful, we had lunch at Blue Waters Inn where some day we shall return to. His whole philosophy is mine completely "Don't worry bout a thing, be happy" a lovely man very funny too. Thank you Mr B we will always remember our day with you.
reviews.title: Toucan Inn

description: Toucan Inn is a small and friendly 20 room hotel with teakwood caribbean style decor set amidst am oasis of lush tropical gardens with a relaxed ambiance that keep guests coming back for more.
